name: St. Paul Miki

locations.description: Japanese Jesuit martyr, one of the 26 Martyrs of Japan

summary: Paul Miki was a Japanese Jesuit seminarian and one of the 26 Martyrs of Japan. He was the first native Japanese to join the Society of Jesus and was known for his eloquent preaching. During the persecution of Christians under Toyotomi Hideyoshi, he was arrested along with other Christians and crucified in Nagasaki. He is the patron saint of Japan and is remembered for his courage and faith in the face of persecution.
